documents.text: It says on the tube that it spreads as easy as mayonnaise.  I thought that was a weird way to describe a product, but its true.  Easy to work with, clean up and produce professional results.  Great product.
documents.product_title: Sashco Big Stretch Acrylic Latex High-Performance Caulking Sealant, 10.5 Ounce Cartridge, White (Pack of 12)

documents.text: The original versions of this item - made by Discwasher, as well as the earlier Milty versions - are great. What this accessory is intended to do is WONDERFUL... HOWEVER, the newer models by Milty are just made cheaply. They just don't work. If they do work for a little while, they tend to break down quickly. If you're thinking of investing in this product, I recommend seaking out an older Zerostat gun - ideally made in England by Discwasher.
The shipping was expensive but the product rocks! It was easy to assemble and now one person can easily move the car about the garage to make room while doing projects
documents.product_title: Allstar Performance ALL10135 5000 lbs Aluminum Deluxe Caster Wheel Dolly, (Pack of 2)

documents.text:
This is the answer to using up your nitro too quickly when you're burning acr pipes.  It's a floaty ball gauge, and shows that you have a flow.  Mind the inlet pressure is max 50psi.  Also it might be just a tad fragile, so knocking over the bottle when in use would hurt.
Do not over tighten the needle valve, cause you'll probably turn it off and on that way..
documents.product_title: Turbo Torch 0386-0849 NFM-TT Nitrogen Flow Meter

documents.text: I expected this piece of Acetal to be in clean, machine shop condition.  It arrived from Amazon scratched up and almost looked used.  That really isn't my big complaint though, I'm most annoyed the material received is not actually 1/4" as advertised.  I'm not sure if Amazon is shipping from different suppliers, or someone just didn't take the time to measure, but the piece has ".250" and "6mm" printed on it.  Obviously, both of these measurements cannot be accurate, as .250"=6.35mm and 6mm=.236".  According to my calibrated caliper, both measurements are incorrect, as I measured 6.89mm or .271".  This wouldn't be a issue if you're just planning on using it to make some spare part where thickness isn't critical, but if an engineering plan calls for .250", then you are now stuck with machining the face, which takes up time and add to tool wear.
documents.product_title: Acetal Copolymer Sheet, Opaque Black, Standard Tolerance, ASTM D6100/UL 94HB, 0.250" Thickness, 6" Width, 12" Length

dimensions.name: reliability
dimensions.description:
the review is considered reliable, as opposed to reporting
unreliable information

dimensions.name: neutrality
dimensions.description:
the review is expressed in objective terms, as opposed to
resulting subjective or biased

dimensions.name: comprehensibility
dimensions.description:
the review is understandable/readable as
opposed to difficult to understand

dimensions.name: precision
dimensions.description: the review is precise/specific, as opposed to vague.

dimensions.name: completeness
dimensions.description: the review is complete as opposed to partial

dimensions.name: informativeness
dimensions.description:
the review allows deriving useful information as
opposed to well-known facts and/or tautologies

dimensions.name: confidence
dimensions.description: How confidence are you about your previous answers?
